document.title: Canon Christian Academy
document.sourceURL: private school self generated standards not verifiable

9268C0EE719A4444904B64F6CDE75DEB.description: Describe the points in support of the argument and employ well-articulated evidence.Â

293F35791BCA4A6981AA654899D2B3D4.description: State a clear position or perspective in support of an argument or proposal.

8C4E7DD4EC5F4F96881A9D4F48215398.description: Include evidence generated through the formal research process (e.g., use of a card catalog, Reader's Guide to Periodical Literature, computer databases, magazines, news- papers, dictionaries).

2CE93A3CE0C34DA3AAF650A110BCF512.description: Convey clear and accurate perspectives on the subject.

5BFC80A5C88C48FD8D88AE44B2445C1D.description: Pose relevant and concise questions about the topic.

99B5BF0D90244B7BAC562953BBF91857.description: Convey a comprehensive understanding of sources, not just superficial details.

F14B24B1190D48FF904DAA80295A1A65.description: Use the student's own words, except for material quoted from sources.

99B19D60B2C34F0E90071FAB0A6FC988.description: Include the main ideas of the event or article and the most significant details.

6AC5B2865AD6445F839F256FE69EAE1B.description: Deliver oral summaries of articles and books:

9C75B05714714F0EB0B0BF08BAE9DFB6.description: Use a range of appropriate strategies, including dialogue, suspense, and naming of specific narrative action (e.g., movement, gestures, expressions).

BF3080D0558845D88F385DCC1F462B82.description: Describe complex major and minor characters and a definite setting.

8C4D6A8DC9814D1887D8BF115C16E3BB.description: Establish a context, standard plot line (having a beginning, conflict, rising action, climax, and denouement), and point of view.

C5A69719E03E4908A5D232A1D06390D8.description: Students deliver well-organized formal presentations employing traditional rhetorical strategies (e.g., narration, exposition, persuasion, description). Student speaking demonstrates a command of standard American English and the organizational and delivery strategies outlined in Listening and Speaking Standard 1.0. Using the speaking strategies of grade seven outlined in Listening and Speaking Standard 1.0, students:

EE55F294A6414153BECD7806D83632C1.description: Analyze the effect on the viewer of images, text, and sound in electronic journalism; identify the techniques used to achieve the effects in each instance studied.Â

265838A203794EDBB767AE1AC8D8B6DB.description: Provide constructive feedback to speakers concerning the coherence and logic of a speech's content and delivery and its overall impact upon the listener.

5C0B2DC85E9A42CD9FF11D9ED4564D2E.description: Analysis and Evaluation of Oral and Media Communications

28930413D0F548EAA5F948CC75EED471.description: Use speaking techniques, including voice modulation, inflection, tempo, enunciation, and eye contact, for effective presentations.

75CC762C811B4B1898697EED5DD8DC98.description: Arrange supporting details, reasons, descriptions, and examples effectively and persuasively in relation to the audience.

932CB08838624CD38C94EE739B8994D5.description: Organize information to achieve particular purposes and to appeal to the background and interests of the audience.

8C12BA25D7B84ADDAA82EAEC3D52C109.description: Organization and Delivery of Oral Communication

A2339C36A2294106956CEF0B3F75A223.description: Respond to persuasive messages with questions, challenges, or affirmations.

3DCF48A6AB6E4CB184CDF835C8291446.description: Determine the speaker's attitude toward the subject.

9F7EA5F0EDF54824AB4BCE2DF4D8B336.description: Ask probing questions to elicit information, including evidence to support the speaker's claims and conclusions.

B8BE369C806644B59D4A7D35880DC610.description: Deliver focused, coherent presentations that convey ideas clearly and relate to the background and interests of the audience. Students evaluate the content of oral communication.

BB89819DDFD24BCAA809CE663B3E2AE4.description: Spell derivatives correctly by applying the spellings of bases and affixes.

BB04B2F2B40C46739B069B355DF4AE87.description: Identify hyphens, dashes, brackets, and semicolons and use them correctly.

BA58DF2285BA460195DCEC8AE144445A.description: Demonstrate the mechanics of writing (e.g., quotation marks, commas at end of dependent clauses) and appropriate English usage (e.g., pronoun reference).Â

DA81609706A9486FB81876EA0536145C.description: Identify all parts of speech and types and structure of sentences.

A5DBEAC0F34C4928BEE69285EDD9A990.description: Identify and use infinitives and participles and make clear references between pronouns and antecedents.

5AE75F76B94644BDA209D08519CB1987.description: Place modifiers properly and use the active voice.

4FAE495348A24C49848223ABE33C64F1.description: Students write and speak with a command of standard English conventions appropriate to the grade level.Â

14F208E642D9404FABF293713A6BC7CA.description: Written and Oral English Language Conventions

F6E4B34DAB9A440DBDF4F41CA31DDCDF.description: Written and Oral English Language Conventions

1C879628AF614A5D991AC751ED05BB2F.description: Reflect underlying meaning, not just the superficial details.

4E281A58C09A40D39311F56BB3E1A897.description: Use the student's own words, except for quotations.

FC518F6ABDB347B2A0F6A6359C850F42.description: Include the main ideas and most significant details.

19E5ED5DC0E14E4C98ACA141C451A3C2.description: Anticipate and address reader concerns and counterarguments.

B4BC693B780B406DAA9E740C043618D9.description: Describe the points in support of the proposition, employing well-articulated evidence.

1ED8A3930B0E4BB49C8818FE7C8A7B3C.description: State a clear position or perspective in support of a proposition or proposal.

F90F7C424CFC4BC381F49701CEBB497B.description: Document reference sources by means of footnotes and a bibliography.

A125CA0C32BD42698C029111A5F2D018.description: Include evidence compiled through the formal research process (e.g., use of a card catalog, Reader's Guide to Periodical Literature, a computer catalog, magazines, newspapers, dictionaries).

40C5776837594A17A02A8E703204E336.description: Convey clear and accurate perspectives on the subject.

84458CFF7C074B3E84609B671A4EFD4C.description: Pose relevant and tightly drawn questions about the topic.

EF95D799C905435D9C1FF3317E6B2B27.description: Justify interpretations through sustained use of examples and textual evidence.

72A4EF60647A4CAAA58E8DF1C8C3E557.description: Organize interpretations around several clear ideas, premises, or images from the literary work.

2D5B255672B2436ABFE6B5CB18470245.description: Develop interpretations exhibiting careful reading, understanding, and insight.

31698AF1C6694983B2FB3B0774B2CFA1.description: Use a range of appropriate strategies (e.g., dialogue; suspense; naming of specific narrative action, including movement, gestures, and expressions).

12BC079489D8488C99406A8BC40A7B8D.description: Develop complex major and minor characters and a definite setting.

B5B19C6EE29D4A37939A3AB9B8CAC91C.description: Develop a standard plot line (having a beginning, conflict, rising action, climax, and denouement) and point of view.

DE6CBFDA6BB04EB0AC284175F61364C6.description: Using the writing strategies of grade seven outlined in Writing Standard 1.0, students will:

0DF2091161EA4CAFA14F8712D2E2CE28.description: Writing Applications (Genres and Their Characteristics) Â Students write narrative, expository, persuasive, and descriptive texts of at least 500 to 700 words in each genre. The writing demonstrates a command of standard American English and the research, organizational, and drafting strategies outlined in Writing Standard 1.0.

0B1E56E7306A4E5CB7968538DED2A7AD.description: Revise writing to improve organization and word choice after checking the logic of the ideas and the precision of the vocabulary.Â

C9DD018F5FB8471094235F9C95BF145A.description: Create documents by using word-processing skills and publishing programs; develop simple databases and spreadsheets to manage information and prepare reports.

2AA6518E1F414F409B5DD97FAAD58D06.description: Give credit for both quoted and paraphrased information in a bibliography by using a consistent and sanctioned format and methodology for citations.

4FF348D2BD0948B69530B4C562ED4A49.description: Identify topics; ask and evaluate questions; and develop ideas leading to inquiry, investigation, and research.

FF9881E2F6E740FF977A6535EF7FDEA9.description: Use strategies of notetaking, outlining, and summarizing to impose structure on composition drafts. Research and TechnologyÂ

B751E0CF5D274777B7821D2C66E42193.description: Support all statements and claims with anecdotes, descriptions, facts and statistics, and specific examples.

14FC355F7F6C468999FF91BEE0895E5E.description: Create an organizational structure that balances all aspects of the composition and uses effective transitions between sentences to unify important ideas.

59DDB2E5D944458888341DEB94482F36.description: Â Students write clear, coherent, and focused essays. The writing exhibits students' awareness of the audience and purpose. Essays contain formal introductions, supporting evidence, and conclusions. Students progress through the stages of the writing process as needed.

D1082A1867AC463EBCA52BFDD869D178.description: Analyze a range of responses to a literary work and determine the extent to which the literary elements in the work shaped those responses.

DDAE89448582402787ECD526A6AA1F31.description: Contrast points of view (e.g., first and third person, limited and omniscient, subjective and objective) in narrative text and explain how they affect the overall theme of the work.

9A820085B98648B48E4B31CB5D6A3306.description: Identify and analyze recurring themes across works (e.g., the value of bravery, loyalty, and friendship; the effects of loneliness).Â

C57A40012EDC40E5B955A3F19AAF30B2.description: Analyze characterization as delineated through a character's thoughts, words, speech patterns, and actions; the narrator's description; and the thoughts, words, and actions of other characters.Â

62CFD431F4A04922B3041EFB6E6818AE.description: Identify events that advance the plot and determine how each event explains past or present action(s) or foreshadows future action(s).

8436B3F9BAF948439A92E35764028802.description: Articulate the expressed purposes and characteristics of different forms of prose (e.g., short story, novel, novella, essay).Â

4DB40F4BF4454B509B33FEC3302F0C21.description: Literary Response and Analysis Students read and respond to historically or culturally significant works of literature that reflect and enhance their studies of history and social science. They clarify the ideas and connect them to other literary works. The selections in Recommended Literature, Kindergarten Through Grade Twelve illustrate the quality and complexity of the materials to be read by students.Â

8CC699B0C9CC4C25B1BE1E3DAC9D5EDD.description: Assess the adequacy, accuracy, and appropriateness of the author's evidence to support claims and assertions, noting instances of bias and stereotyping.Â

A067C50487764A428E83B28FEDE32590.description: Understand and explain the use of a simple mechanical device by following technical directions.Â

942F7D6DB9734BAD932327A5F37EEC1D.description: Identify and trace the development of an author's argument, point of view, or perspective in text.Â

867CBB2D2B7040F3A7A54796FAB9D3B0.description: Comprehension and Analysis of Grade-Level-Appropriate Text

6B917CE14D2B401EAB32834C6B349A0C.description: Analyze text that uses the cause-and-effect organizational pattern.Â

7903BA653C3F4805A35A626F2ACE6317.description: Locate information by using a variety of consumer, workplace, and public documents.

E108ABCF67BA4347A8697A2BFD4CDB92.description: Understand and analyze the differences in structure and purpose between various categories of informational materials (e.g., textbooks, newspapers, instructional manuals, signs).Â

0B5E717D8BE64A2B94451800FCBC2AB6.description: Reading Comprehension (Focus on Informational Materials) Students read and understand grade-level-appropriate material. They describe and connect the essential ideas, arguments, and perspectives of the text by using their knowledge of text structure, organization, and purpose. The selections in Recommended Literature, Kindergarten Through Grade Twelve illustrate the quality and complexity of the materials to be read by students. In addition, by grade eight, students read one million words annually on their own, including a good representation of grade-level-appropriate narrative and expository text (e.g., classic and contemporary literature, magazines, newspapers, online information). In grade seven, students make substantial progress toward this goal.

EFEE35C0756944CA8AA9FB3ED55BBB84.description: Clarify word meanings through the use of definition, example, restatement, or contrast.Â

DF5E8021378B464B95E47BE8896D0AAB.description: Use knowledge of Greek, Latin, and Anglo-Saxon roots and affixes to understand content-area vocabulary.

4FF53E6F48D14A11B95F5BBF9525D7D9.description: Identify idioms, analogies, metaphors, and similes in prose and poetry.Â

C765CA2FD9464BA68FABCDAEBE9A5C2B.description: Students use their knowledge of word origins and word relationships, as well as historical and literary context clues, to determine the meaning of specialized vocabulary and to understand the precise meaning of grade-level-appropriate words.

8890E625A5C341139A1D47B035C42253.description: Word Analysis, Fluency, and Systematic Vocabulary Development
